title: Can Root abilities actually root?
body:
instead of champions completing their channeled dashes or champions jumping/blinking and then rooting root should be applied the exact location where it is cast. I'm tired of Yasuo being able to get to me mid E because root applies only after the E animation is complete

edit: apparently yasuo can be stopped, so I guess that was a bad example. what I mean is tristana jump, ezreal blink, kindred jump etc

replies.body: Roots should apply the grounding debuff or at least interrupt all mobility effects.

Agreed, and stuns as well. There's no particular reason for hard CC to behave inconsistently relative to mobility when displacements have always been coded to knock champions out of their dashes, and the fact that this separation still exists I think speaks more to legacy coding and balancing on Riot's part than anything else. Allowing hard CC to cleanly knock dashing targets down would add a ton more consistency to the game, as well as generate much more meaningful interaction between the two effects (most CC is already difficult to land on fast-moving opponents, so it doesn't need to also have a reduced impact when it does land). Additionally, it could probably limit knockup creep by some amount, as I suspect many champions got displacements on their kits, simply because displacements are better stuns.

That that entirely concur with, and it's why displacements were rare to begin with, until they nerfed tenacity. Still get the latency differential screwing up interactions too, where dashes and blinks go off after being stunned, which is just as frustrating.

Their huge-ass range dashes should most *definitely* be stopped by roots/stuns/snares/charms/fears, because it's simply that much longer of a dash. Let them get over any terrain they're over, sure, but *make it stop them as soon as they're over normal ground*.

Or, at the very least, for fuck's sake, make the duration of the CC only start *after* the dash stops. If I've rooted them and they're going to keep moving anyways, at least make sure that they don't get to ignore the *entirety* of my Lux Q just by being mid-air.
